title: The-Kremlin-Letter-1970-ENG
description:
The Kremlin Letter (1970) is a terrific movie that&#039;s very difficult to find on VHS or DVD. Starring Max Von Sydow, Orson Welles and Patrick O&#039;Neal playing a naval man drafted into the Intelligence Community because he has a photographic memory and is able to speak fluent Russian.  He is given the task of retrieving an embarrasing letter between ambassadors that could start WWIII. Helping him is a motley team of undercover (and underworld) sorts, including Richard Boone as O&#039;Neal&#039;s superior, charming and menacing both at the same time, George Sanders as a drag artist, and a beautiful safecracker (who opens safes with her feet while lying on her back), played by Barbara Parkins, with whom O&#039;Neal falls in love. The characterizations and the acting are first-rate and filming was mostly done in Helsinki.  Huston, who also plays a small role, directs with a deceptive touch of nonchalance that seems to imply wariness and uninvolvement but in fact, the film is a highly absorbing tale that sustains interest from beginning to end.  Ending has a helluva twist.   

If you miss the first five minutes, you miss one suicide, two executions, one seduction and the key to the plot!!!



Tagline: Don&#039;t trust anyone in the Kremlin Letter



IMDB record:      <a href=" http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0065950/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0065950/</a>      



Seeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeed MF !!!
